Articles.Content:
One thing bothers me about current implementation of science. As long as you stay within one biome it doesn't matter where you perform experiment, make EVA report or take sample. So, you don't have much to do on landing site. It would be nice if there were reason to walk (or drive) around while picking some different objects or samples. Rocks, soil patches, plants etc. I mean, to have scientific diversity whithin one landing site.

What do you think?

That would be something to look forward to in the final product. Not to mention a home planet that looks, inhabited? I don't know why but I want to be able to "land" my space plane on Main St. in downtown Kerbalopolis.

Agree with OP, but as I understand it this is basically confirmed for future development so all in good time.

On that point though, it seems like a very simple addition to make, leading me to believe the devs have even bigger plans for this area that are yet to be implemented....

I'm not sure how they would make Biomes more diverse though.

You could make alot of biomes, but that'd just result in gigantic amounts of way to much science, that'll create more problems that awnsers.

But a little something to do once you're landed would be nice though

@Bradford: I believe they are indeed planning cities down the line

First people aren't satisifed about the amount of biomes, now people complain about the diversity of experiments within them.

The answer is the same: systems before content
Another thing, and a rather minor one, is that Duna has only one biome when you can tell just by looking at it that there are at least two.

As already said, they will be doing more, just give them time! This is their first game, it's taken over 3 years to get this far... I suggest you have a go at one or two of the older versions of KSP to see how far they've come
This suggestion for the game's development has been moved to the Suggestions and Development subforum.

Try the custom biomes mod by trueborn (updated for 24.2!). It adds biomes to every planet/moon that doesn't have them.

Link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66256

Another thing, and a rather minor one, is that Duna has only one biome when you can tell just by looking at it that there are at least two.

Minmus also used to have only 1 biome. They'll add new biomes eventually, but for now, this is MORE than enough biomes. You can already complete the techtree 5 times over, no need to add 10 times more science yet
